author: CNN Newssource
title: SoCal beaches face ongoing high surf warnings as massive waves threaten the coast
text:
SoCal beaches face ongoing high surf warnings as massive waves threaten the coast
By AMY MAETZOLD
Click here for updates on this story
SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA (
KCAL) — Southern California anticipates large waves throughout the weekend, increasing flood risk and posing dangers for beach communities.
The entire coastline in Ventura County, including beaches, harbors, and piers, will be closed on Friday due to high surf and flooding concerns. The closures are listed below:
Ventura Pier All Ventura Beaches City of Oxnard All City of Oxnard public beaches City of Port Hueneme Port Hueneme Pier Faria Beach Hobson Beach Rincon Parkway RV Area Kiddy Beach Silverstrand Beach Hollywood by the Sea California State Parks Ventura State Beach McGrath State Beach Mandalay State Beach San Buenaventura State Beach Emma Wood Campground Harbors Channel Islands Harbor Entry Ventura Harbor Entry A high surf warning was issued for Ventura and Los Angeles Counties and will remain in effect until 10 p.m. on Saturday. Waves ranging from 8 to 13 feet are expected, with the possibility of isolated sets reaching up to 20 feet.
The NWS warns of extremely hazardous beach conditions, emphasizing the risk of drowning and damage to coastal structures like piers and jetties.
Forecasters highlight west-facing beaches such as Hermosa, Manhattan, and Palos Verdes will be the areas with the highest surf.
A coastal flooding advisory will remain in effect for Los Angeles County beaches, including the Malibu coast and Catalina Island, until 10 p.m. on Saturday. Residents in the area should expect flooding in low-lying areas, including parking lots, beaches and walkways during high tide.
In Orange County, a high surf warning and coastal flood advisory will remain in effect until 2 a.m. Monday. Forecasters predict waves of 6 to 12 feet, with sets of up to 15 feet in northern Orange County.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: Amanda Lee and Matt Trapani
title: DOT: Tractor-trailer crash closes parts of Route 1&9 in Woodbridge; detours in place - NewsBreak
text: Route 1&9 is closed in both directions in Woodbridge township due to a tractor-trailer crash on Tuesday afternoon. The New Jersey Department of Transportation says the truck knocked down a traffic signal and three utility poles near Randolph and East Milton avenues around 12:15 p.m. Crews are on the scene to clean the debris and make repairs. The DOT says the repairs are expected to last into the evening hours. The DOT says the following detours are in place until further notice: Route 1&9 northbound detour: Route 1&9 southbound detour:

author: Alisan Duran
title: Olivia Dunne Shorts Shows Off Impressive Handstand Split
text:
Olivia Dunne continues to captivate fans with her extraordinary skills, showcasing them in a jaw-dropping video!
In a recent showcase of agility and strength, Dunne, 21, wowed audiences as she flawlessly executed an impressive handstand split. Dressed in stylish tight shorts, she not only exhibited her athletic prowess but also showcased her flair for fashion.
The Athletic Elegance Instagram Stories | Olivia Dunne The LSU gymnast’s handstand split is a testament to her unparalleled athleticism and grace. Her seamless transition into a perfect split while maintaining a handstand position requires a combination of strength, flexibility, and precise control — qualities that Dunne has mastered throughout her gymnastics career. Her performance goes beyond mere physical prowess; it embodies the sheer elegance that defines elite gymnastics.
Dunne “Locker room actives.”
Stylish Statement in Tight Shorts
 Olivia Dunne (@livvydunne)
Adding a touch of fashion to her athletic prowess, Dunne chose to showcase her skills in chic tight shorts. The choice of attire not only accentuates her movements but also highlights her keen sense of style.
As a fashion-forward athlete, the SI Swimsuit newcomer effortlessly merges the worlds of sport and style, proving that athleticism and fashion can coexist harmoniously.
Social Media Buzz Instagram Stories | Olivia Dunne Unsurprisingly, Dunne’s jaw-dropping handstand split in tight shorts has created a buzz on TikTok. Fans expressed incredible display of talent.
“LIVVY, YOU BELONG IN HOLLYWOOD, IN THE MOVIES!!!!” wrote one person, while another noted, “Best on the internet.
The third user told Dunne, “Do you know why everyone loves you? It’s because you have IT. That is the factor.”
A fourth commenter added, “That is the most gymnast thing I have ever seen.”
Empowering A New Generation @livvy locker room activities #foryou #lsu #gymnastics ♬ original sound – iris ⠀
As a role model for aspiring athletes, Dunne continues to empower a new generation of gymnasts. Her ability to seamlessly blend athletic prowess with a sense of style sends a positive message — one that encourages individuals to embrace their passions while expressing their unique personalities.
The gymnast’s influence extends beyond the gym, inspiring young athletes to take pride in their skills and showcase them confidently.
The Intersection of Sport and Fashion Instagram | Olivia Dunne Dunne’s choice of tight shorts during her handstand split performance highlights the evolving intersection of sport and fashion. Athletes are increasingly embracing their roles as style influencers, proving that performance and aesthetics can go hand in hand.
The TikTik video from Dunne came after LSU finished third in the SEC championships behind Flordia and Alabama.
Dunne and her teammate, Aleah Finnegan, achieved an impressive score of 9.850 on the parallel bars.
Expressing his sentiments about the team’s performance, head coach Jay Clark stated in an LSU press release , “We’re always disappointed when we know we left things on the floor, but the other part of that is that they continued to show their fight and their grit.”
Stronger Than Ever Instagram Stories | Olivia Dunne In the previous year, as reported by The Blast , Dunne posted a video showcasing her handstand split shortly after recovering from a leg injury.
In this specific post, she sported a form-fitting black leotard. The gymnastics attire featured a high neckline, snugly embracing her chest and contouring to the curves of her slender torso. The high-cut bottoms accentuated her narrow hips, revealing her long, lean legs. The sleeveless design of the garment drew attention to Dunne’s muscular arms and shoulders.

author: TOI News Desk
title: Hindutva: Hindu and Hindutva are different: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah | India News - Times of India
text: NEW DELHI: Karnataka's chief minister on Thursday sparked a controversy by saying that there is a difference between 'Hindu' and 'Hindutva'. In a recent address at the 139th Congress Foundation Day in Bengaluru, the CM said that while the state respects and practices Hindu traditions like worshipping Ram and organizing Ram Bhajans, the version of Hindutva espoused by the BJP is inauthentic.The chief minister criticized the BJP, Jan Sangh, RSS, and Sangh Parivar for their lack of participation in the Indian freedom struggle, contrasting this with the Congress party's significant role in it. He urged people to recognize and spread awareness about the BJP's falsehoods.Siddaramaiah highlighted the Congress party's achievements post-independence, citing the construction of dams during Nehru's tenure and attributing the expansion of the internet in India to late PM Rajiv Gandhi. He accused the BJP of being adept in spreading lies.He asserted that social justice in India is a result of the Congress party's efforts. The CM expressed confidence in the party's future successes, mentioning Rahul Gandhi's upcoming padayatra and his potential to lead the country as the next Prime Minister.

author: VNExplorer
title: Dublin man presumed dead in Ukraine went to war to 'defend his heritage'
text: Alex Rhyzuk AN IRISHMAN PRESUMED dead in Ukraine had plans to return home and join the Irish Defence Forces. Alex Rhyzuk (20) began volunteering with the Ukrainian army two years ago. He was recently reported missing and is now presumed dead. Just two weeks ago, RTÉ’s Prime Time broadcast a special report from the frontlines in Ukraine. Rhyzuk was one of the interviewees. In previously unseen footage, he explains why he felt compelled to travel to Ukraine and risk his life. He lost several friends and family members in the war, and had followed developments on Telegram from the beginning. Having little siblings, I could not let this go. “At the end of the day, I was born and raised in Ireland. It’s given me many opportunities and many things in my life that I’m grateful for … but at the same time I cannot forget my heritage.” Rhyzuk’s parents are Ukrainian and came to Ireland over two decades ago. He grew up in Rathmines, Dublin, and was educated in CBS Synge Street, which he said he had “very good memories” of. He explained that, when he expressed interest in fighting in the war, his parents hid his passport to try to protect him. When they didn’t give it back, Rhyzuk applied for a new one and at the age of 18 travelled to war-torn Ukraine. He had only planned to stay for a year, but when the time was up, he decided he couldn’t go home yet, as he became “addicted” to the war. “War is brutal,” he said. In war if you value your life too much, you go into a very bad stage. “If someone unfortunately dies, the biggest responsibility we have at that point is to get their bodies back [home] so they can have a proper funeral.” Rhyzuk only has an Irish passport, not a Ukrainian one, which may make his repatriation more difficult. Finn Boylan of FinnHouse Films was the last person to interview Rhyzuk on camera. “He was highly-effective at what he did. Motivated, driven.. He was a man with huge ideals to defend his heritage,” said Boylan. He also said Rhyzuk had told him of his plans to return to Ireland and join the Irish Defence Forces’ Ranger Wing. He says his last message to Rhyzuk was: “Are you alive?” “It’s difficult to have another ghost haunt my hard drive … but nobody else has to speak for him, he can speak for himself,” said Boylan, referring to the footage taken of Rhyzuk just weeks ago.

author: sonix
title: #31 El papa Francisco pidió a Ucrania que levante la bandera blanca y negocie la paz
text:
[HackerRuso](/user/HackerRuso)a [ambito.com](/go/link/3916814) [#1](c1#c-1) Realista diría.
Ucrania no tiene posibilidad alguna de ganar la guerra, es como si España entrara en guerra con USA, más vale una retirada a tiempo a que siga muriendo gente.
Dejemos que los ucranianos decidan libremente su futuro en las próximas elecciones...
Ah! No! Que tienen prohibida a la oposición y encarcelados (los que no han sido asesinados) a los disidentes. Y el país tan endeudado que no pueden hacer otra cosa que no sea lo que le digan sus dueños extranjeros. Eso sin contar con el tema de la corrupción endémica que compra voluntades en muchos casos para poder sobrevivir.
Si se hubiera dedicado a lo que prometió cuando lo eligieron: acabar con la guerra civil y conseguir la reconciliación nacional. Pero se dejó engañar por los cantos de sirena y ahora va camino de ser otro Sadam Hussein engañado por el Imperio, aunque aún está a tiempo de terminar como otro Guaidó refugiado.
[#14](c14#c-14) Hay partidos opositores en el parlamento ucraniano.
Ahora moverás la portería a que no son opositores de verdad.
"[...] Cuando ves que estás derrotado, que las cosas no van, necesitas tener el coraje de negociar”. Supongo que el Papa estará informado de la situación sobre el terreno como para decir eso.
[#4](c4#c-4) ¿Tú en serio crees que puede? ¿ Puede el sahara español decidir su futuro ? pues no, y lo sabes. ¿Pueden los gazatíes decidir su futuro? pues tampoco, y lo sabes, y así hasta el infinito. ¿Puede el Nepal decidir su futuro si a China se le pone entre ceja y ceja la idea de asaltarla? pues tampoco, podríamos seguir contínuamente. Sólo te salvas si tienes al "primo de zumosol" que te apoya o bien formas parte de algo más grande como la otan, pero en caso contrario lo tienes clarinete, pero vamos, que esto habrá sido así desde que el mundo es mundo, ¿Puede un conejo decidir su futuro si un depredador ya lo ha atrapado? no se.. es lo mismo. Al margen de si está bien o está mal, el mundo no va de eso.
[#12](c12#c-12) No se que te metes pero si crees lo que dices sabes que esa tumba va a ser a costa de muchas muertes o algo peor en todo Europa.
Que hubieran invertido en armamento en su momento o integrado en la OTAN. Ahora a ceder en lo que pida Rusia.
